channel.title: Hardware on Peter's Notebook
channel.description: Recent content in Hardware on Peter's Notebook

item.title: Dual Hetero Quadro on Heaven
item.description: Literally the punchiest title I could come up with. I’ve been told that heterogeneous GPU setups are ridiculously slower than a single-GPU. This is largely an anecdotal shrug of “hey - a second GPU doesn’t really slow my computer down in any meaningful manner at all!” I’m sure that I did this all wrong and that the GPU is capable of being tweaked into a setting where this all becomes conclusively - the legwork for that isn’t interesting to me so I haven’t done it.
